content.title: Product Daily Check-in
content.visibleText:
Product Daily Check-in
Fri, Jun 04, 2023 1:30pm â€“ 2:46pm
Recap
Notes Transcript
product daily check-in
Summary
The meeting discussed various topics related to customer engagement, product development, and team alignment. The importance of understanding customer needs and tailoring messaging to diverse customer personas was emphasized. The team explored the possibilities of using AI to generate captions and summaries that cater to various customer needs, highlighting the significance of customizing AI features to align with the specific communication style and personas of different customers. The conversation also revolved around the importance of feedback, qualitative evaluation, and understanding customer needs in driving the development and success of features.
Chapters & Topics
Discussion on Customer Engagement and Product Development
AI Features and Customer Feedback
View more
Action Items
George Data will write up the feedback for Dragos and share it with the team.
Dragos Nita will discuss the next week's developments with the team.
George Data will push for the release of all features in one or two weeks.
View more
Key Questions

content.title: Email from George Dita
content.layoutDescription: Email content displayed prominently in the center
content.visibleText: Instead of trying to think how to phrase it, just put it in the 'random thoughts' category and I'll follow has the transcripts. I would try to take every meeting that we have and filter out random things said. Create a pool for product managers that are complex. You are so bent on something, that has a period in understanding, extracting information and summarizing meeting transcripts. Your task is to answer questions about the information present in the transcript. If the answer to the question is not in the transcript, say 'This information is not in the transcript', or 'No more info available'. When possible, add your own notes from the knowledge that are not relevant to the questions when answering it. Only reply to questions where you are sure. And find just ask 'What ideas or suggestions did 6h ago have with respect to the following topics: User suggestions, Messaging, Ads, Authorization, Notifications, Widget, UX, Job, Office, Whispers of Jobs, Milestones done. Have a respectful, thoughtful, and objective chat with respect to the objectives and the job of the product manager, managing the tasks.

content.title: Create
content.visibleText:
What should be emphasized or avoided in the responses?

when a meeting transcript is attached, you should always analyze it and make Q&A style answers, and always answer the questions below from the transcript's copy.

1. What are all the ideas discussed in this call?
2. What are the different approaches discussed in this call?
3. What are all the decisions taken?
4. What advice did somebody in the team give somebody else?
5. What ideas or suggestions did heroes have with respect to the following topics or subjects: Messenger, Monitor, AdvocateHub, Postpony, Influitive, Jive, CQpit
6. What ideas or suggestions does Dragnos have with respect to the following topics or subjects:
- Messenger: Dragnos discussed the difficulty of comparing Messenger with Influitive due to different user bases and engagement levels.
- Monitor: No specific mention of Monitor.
- AdvocateHub: Dragnos suggested creating engaging challenges and using customer feedback to iterate

content.title: Preview
content.visibleText:
To prioritize iterative improvements based on customer feedback over new feature development.
To deploy CNU for rapid POC development and validation with customers.
To adopt a structured approach for the next quarter, emphasizing customer engagement and feedback.
To assist customers with product upgrades to maintain ABR.

What advice did somebody in the team give somebody else?
Dragnos emphasized the importance of iterating on customer feedback and refining product features rather than rushing into build new ones.
The suggestion to engage with customers early in the quarter to validate ideas before committing to development.
Advice on using educational videos or videos to improve customer engagement and understanding of new features.
